# Survival data analysis using TKTD model GUTS with time exposure variable concentration

Data set : Diazinon and *Pimephales promelas*.
This data set is taken from the fathead minnow toxicity database[Geiger1988]. It represents a typical fish acute
toxicity study, and it includes a hypothetical exposure profile representing a typical FOCUS-SW ditch and a real exposure profile from chemical monitoring in a stream [Wittmer2010, Ashauer2011].


## Step 1: check the structure and the dataset integrity and create a `survData` object

```{r diazinon data, include=FALSE, echo=FALSE}
data(gm_diazinonPimephales_Nsurv)
data(gm_diazinonPimephales_conc)
```

```{r step 1, cache=TRUE}
df_Nsurv = gm_diazinonPimephales_Nsurv %>%
  filter(varType == "var") %>%
  select(-varType)
df_conc = gm_diazinonPimephales_conc %>%
   filter(varType == "var") %>%
   select(-varType)

# Check the structure and the dataset integrity 
gm_survDataCheck(data_surv = df_Nsurv,
                 data_conc = df_conc)

```


Build the `gm_survData` object

```{r step 1b, cache=TRUE}
var_data = gm_survData(data_surv = df_Nsurv,
                       data_conc = df_conc)

head(var_data)
```



## Step 2: visualize your dataset

The function `plot` can be used to plot the number of surviving individuals
as a function of time for all profiles.

```{r step 2, cache=TRUE}
plot(var_data)

plot(var_data,
     facetting.level = c("varControl","varA","varB","varC"))

plot(var_data,
     facetting = FALSE)
```

The function `summary` provides some descriptive statistics on the experimental design.

```{r , cache=TRUE}
summary(var_data)
```


## Step 3: fit an exposure-response model to the survival data at target time

### SD model

```{r step3 , eval=FALSE}
fit_varSD <- survFit(var_data, model_type = "SD")
```


```{r, cache=TRUE}
# save(fit_varSD, file = "vignettes/fit_varSD.Rdata")
load("fit_varSD.Rdata")
``` 

### IT model

```{r, eval=FALSE}
fit_varIT <- survFit(var_data, model_type = "IT")
```


```{r, cache=TRUE}
# save(fit_varIT, file = "vignettes/fit_varIT.Rdata")
load("fit_varIT.Rdata")
``` 


## Step 4: print information on analysis (mcmc)

### SD model

```{r, cache=TRUE}
print(fit_varSD)
```

### IT model

```{r, cache=TRUE}
print(fit_varIT)
```

## Step 4: validate the model with a posterior predictive check

### SD model

```{r, cache=TRUE}
ppc(fit_varSD)
```


### IT model

```{r, cache=TRUE}
ppc(fit_varIT)
```

## Step 5: plot the model prediction

### SD model

```{r, cache=TRUE}
plot(fit_varSD, data_type = "probability")
```


```{r, cache=TRUE}
plot(fit_varSD, data_type = "number")
```

### IT model

```{r, cache=TRUE}
plot(fit_varIT, data_type = "probability")
```


```{r, cache=TRUE}
plot(fit_varIT, data_type = "number")
```

## Step 6: summary of priors and posteriors

### SD model

```{r, cache=TRUE}
summary(fit_varSD)
```

### IT model

```{r, cache=TRUE}
summary(fit_varIT)
```
